content:
TITLE: Setting up MSW in a Browser Environment DESCRIPTION: Example of how to set up and use MSW in a browser environment. The code imports the necessary functions, defines a request handler, and starts the worker to begin intercepting requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // 1. Import the library. import { http, HttpResponse } from 'msw' import { setupWorker } from 'msw/browser' // 2. Describe network behavior with request handlers. const worker = setupWorker( http.get('https://github.com/octocat', ({ request, params, cookies }) => { return HttpResponse.json( { message: 'Mocked response', }, { status: 202, statusText: 'Mocked status', }, ) }), ) // 3. Start mocking by starting the Service Worker. await worker.start() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using MSW with Express in Node.js DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to integrate MSW with an Express server in Node.js. This example shows how to use server.boundary() to scope request interception to a specific closure, allowing mock API responses for external services. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import express from 'express' import { http, HttpResponse } from 'msw' import { setupServer } from 'msw/node' const app = express() const server = setupServer() app.get( '/checkout/session', server.boundary((req, res) => { // Describe the network for this Express route. server.use( http.get( 'https://api.stripe.com/v1/checkout/sessions/:id', ({ params }) => { return HttpResponse.json({ id: params.id, mode: 'payment', status: 'open', }) }, ), ) // Continue with processing the checkout session. handleSession(req, res) }), ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating MSW Browser Integration Test Mocks DESCRIPTION: Example of setting up MSW request handlers for browser integration tests, demonstrating how to mock a GET request to a books endpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // test/browser/example.mocks.ts import { http, HttpResponse } from 'msw' import { setupWorker } from 'msw/browser' const worker = setupWorker( http.get('/books', () => { return HttpResponse.json([ { id: 'ea42ffcb-e729-4dd5-bfac-7a5b645cb1da', title: 'The Lord of the Rings', publishedAt: -486867600, }, ]) }), ) worker.start() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Writing an MSW Node.js Integration Test DESCRIPTION: Example of setting up and testing MSW in a Node.js environment, demonstrating how to intercept and mock a GET request. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // test/node/example.test.ts import { http, HttpResponse } from 'msw' import { setupServer } from 'msw/node' const server = setupServer( http.get('/books', () => { return HttpResponse.json([ { id: 'ea42ffcb-e729-4dd5-bfac-7a5b645cb1da', title: 'The Lord of the Rings', publishedAt: -486867600, }, ]) }), ) beforeAll(() => server.listen()) afterAll(() => server.close()) test('returns a mocked response', async () => { const res = await fetch('/books') expect(await res.json()).toEqual([ { id: 'ea42ffcb-e729-4dd5-bfac-7a5b645cb1da', title: 'The Lord of the Rings', publishedAt: -486867600, }, ]) }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Writing an MSW Browser Integration Test DESCRIPTION: Example of a Playwright test that loads an MSW example, makes a request, and verifies the mocked response. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // test/browser/example.test.ts import * as path from 'path' import { test, expect } from './playwright.extend' test('returns a mocked response', async ({ loadExample, fetch }) => { // Compile the given usage example on runtime. await loadExample(require.resolve('./example.mocks.ts')) // Perform the "GET /books" request in the browser. const res = await fetch('/books') // Assert the returned response body. expect(await res.json()).toEqual([ { id: 'ea42ffcb-e729-4dd5-bfac-7a5b645cb1da', title: 'The Lord of the Rings', publishedAt: -486867600, }, ]) }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: File Structure Example for MSW Integration Tests DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the naming convention and file organization for MSW integration tests. Each test consists of a mocks file (*.mocks.ts) containing the example code to test, and a test file (*.test.ts) containing the Vitest test suite. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/test/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` *.mocks.ts *.test.ts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Writing a TypeScript Unit Test for MSW DESCRIPTION: Example of a TypeScript unit test that verifies the functionality of a multiply function. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // src/utils/multiply.test.ts import { multiply } from './multiply' test('multiplies two given numbers', () => { expect(multiply(2, 3)).toEqual(6) }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running MSW Browser Integration Tests DESCRIPTION: Commands to run browser integration tests using Playwright, either all tests or a specific test file. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm test:browser ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running MSW Unit Tests DESCRIPTION: Commands to run unit tests in the MSW project, either all tests or a specific test file. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ pnpm test:unit src/utils/multiply.test.ts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running All MSW Node.js Tests DESCRIPTION: Command to run all Node.js integration tests in the MSW project. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm test:node ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing MSW Development Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone and set up the MSW development environment using PNPM package manager. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ cd msw $ pnpm install $ pnpm start ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Git Workflow for MSW Contributions DESCRIPTION: A series of Git commands demonstrating the recommended workflow for contributing to MSW, from creating a feature branch to pushing changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Checkout the default branch and ensure it's up-to-date $ git checkout main $ git pull --rebase # Create a feature branch $ git checkout -b feature/graphql-subscriptions # Commit the changes $ git add . $ git commit # Follow the interactive prompt to compose a commit message # Push $ git push -u origin feature/graphql-subscriptions ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running a Single MSW Browser Test DESCRIPTION: Command to run a specific browser integration test file. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm test:browser ./test/browser/example.test.ts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running a Single MSW Node.js Test DESCRIPTION: Command to run a specific Node.js integration test file. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm test:node ./test/node/example.test.ts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running All MSW Unit Tests DESCRIPTION: Command to run all unit tests in the MSW project. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ pnpm test:unit ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building the MSW Library DESCRIPTION: Command to build the MSW library from source code. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ pnpm build ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Referencing TypeScript Nightly Validation Workflow in GitHub Actions DESCRIPTION: A reference to a GitHub Actions workflow file that validates MSW against nightly TypeScript releases. This automated job ensures early detection and resolution of compatibility issues. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/decisions/typescript-versioning.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` ../.github/workflows/typescript-nightly.yml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building the MSW Library (Repeated) DESCRIPTION: Command to build the MSW library from source code, repeated from earlier in the document. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ pnpm build ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Bronze Sponsors with HTML Table in Markdown DESCRIPTION: An HTML table embedded in Markdown that displays the logos and links of bronze sponsors for the MSW project, including Materialize, Trigger.dev, and Vital. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Awards and Mentions with HTML Table in Markdown DESCRIPTION: An HTML table embedded in Markdown that showcases awards and mentions received by MSW, including Technology Radar's 'Solution Worth Pursuing' and Open Source Awards' 'The Most Exciting Use of Technology'. SOURCE: https://github.com/mswjs/msw/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

Solution Worth Pursuing

Technology Radar (2020â€“2021)

The Most Exciting Use of Technology

Open Source Awards (2020)
```
